details.name: Silverlight plugin 5.1.41105.0 and lower (click to play)
details.who: All users who have these versions of the Silverlight plugin installed.
details.why: Old versions of the Silverlight plugin are known to have critical security vulnerabilities. You can get the latest version of Silverlight here.

details.name: Mozilla ActiveX Plug-in
details.who: All Firefox users who have this plugin installed.
details.why: This plugin was discontinued years ago and only worked up to Firefox version 1.5. Because plugins aren't marked as incompatible, there are still many users who have it installed and have recently been experiencing crashes related to it.

details.name: Adobe Reader XI for Mac OS X
details.who: All Firefox users on Mac OS X who have installed the Adobe Reader XI plugin. Users are recommended to update when a new version of Adobe Reader becomes available, or to downgrade to the latest version of Adobe Reader 10.
details.why: The Adobe Reader XI plugin is causing frequent crashes on Firefox for Mac OS X. The impact and this block are currently limited to versions 11.0.0 and 11.0.01.

details.name: Java Plugin 6 updates 39 to 41 (click-to-play), Windows
details.who: All users who have these versions of the plugin installed in Firefox.
details.why: Old versions of the Java plugin are potentially insecure and unstable. All users are strongly recommended to update on our plugin check page.

details.name: Flash Player Plugin
details.who: All Firefox users who have a version of the Flash Player Plugin older than 10.2.159.1.
details.why: Old versions of the Flash Player plugin are targeted by known security vulnerabilities, and cause frequent Firefox crashes. We strongly recommend all users to visit the Flash Player homepage to download and install the latest available version of this plugin. This is not an ordinary block. It's just an upgrade notification that will be shown to all users who have these old versions installed, asking them to download the latest version. If they choose to ignore the notification, the plugin will continue to work normally.

details.name: Viewpoint
details.who: All users of the Viewpoint plugin for Firefox 3 and later.
details.why: This plugin causes a high volume of Firefox crashes.

details.name: Java Plugin 7 update 10 and lower (click-to-play), Mac OS X
details.who: All users who have these versions of the plugin installed in Firefox 17 and above.
details.why: The Java plugin is causing significant security problems. All users are strongly recommended to keep the plugin disabled unless necessary.

details.name: Unity Web Player 5.0 to 5.0.3f1 (click-to-play), Mac OS
details.who: All users who have these versions of the plugin installed
details.why: These versions of the Unity Web Player plugin have known vulnerabilities that can put users at risk.

details.name: Java Plugin
details.who: Users of Java 2 Plugin versions 1.5_00 to 1.6_99 in Firefox 3.6 and later.
details.why: These versions of the Java plugin are no longer supported by Oracle and cause a high volume of Firefox crashes.

details.name: Sibelius Scorch plugin
details.who: All users who have Firefox 18 or above installed, and the Sibelius Scorch plugin.
details.why: The Sibelius Scorch plugin is not compatible with Firefox 18 and above, and is crashing whenever loaded on affected versions of Firefox.

details.name: PDF Browser Plugin 2.4.2 and below
details.who: All Firefox users on Mac OS X who are using the affected versions of the PDF Browser Plugin.
details.why: The PDF Browser Plugin is causing frequent crashes on Firefox 18 and above. All users are recommended to keep the plugin disabled and update it if a new version becomes available.

details.name: QuickTime Plugin for Windows
details.who: All users who have the QuickTime Plugin for Windows installed.
details.why: The QuickTime Plugin for Windows has been discontinued by Apple and has known critical security vulnerabilities. All users are strongly encouraged to remove it or keep it disabled.

details.name: Internet Saving Optimizer (plugin)
details.who: All users of Internet Saving Optimizer for all Mozilla applications.
details.why: This plugin causes a high volume of Firefox crashes and is considered malware.

details.name: Adobe Acrobat NPAPI Plug-in

details.why: The Adobe Acrobat plugin doesn't work on Mac OS X in default (64-bit) mode, showing a blank page when users click on links to PDF files in Firefox. It also causes a significant number of crashes in 32-bit mode. There's more information on this blog post.

details.why: Old versions of the Java plugin are potentially insecure and unstable. All users are strongly recommended to update on our plugin check page.

details.name: Adobe Reader 10.1.6 to 11.0.16
